title: just got a 'low priority que' ban because my internet dc'd but i came back 5mins later?.....

replies.body:
Five minutes is the point where Leaver Buster activates.

And everyone who claims they don't deserve to be Leaver Busted always says it "was only five minutes".
I thought it was fifteen minutes, and five minutes is the point where it asks you "Hey bud are you afk?"
Five minutes is the minimal mark. I'm actually quite happy about that because when I have a fully system crash I'm only down for four minutes.
thats good that it gets you personally out of trouble but maybe not the other several million players whose systems might just take that extra 1 min

Except you know, I only get a full system crash once every three months. Which should be the case for most people, especially if they are TAKING CARE OF THEIR COMPUTER LIKE THEY SHOULD.

Three hours a week is all you need to run diagnostics and clean sweeps of your computer, check that everything runs alright. Once a month I even clean my tower out getting rid of dust.

If you are actually crashing so much and for so long that you get Leaver Busted it is 100% your own fault and you deserve it. You are neglecting your computer and making it run while it needs maintenance. Hell you don't even deserve a computer if you treat it like that.

As for internet crashes, that is also on your own head. You can easily find out before you start playing if your internet will be having trouble, and if you don't do that then again you deserve to be banned. The same with power outages, DON'T PLAY IN THE MIDDLE OF A %%%%ING STORM.
And before you even start, NO, your ISP or Energy Company shutting down your Internet or Power for them to do maintenance in the area is not an acceptable excuse as THEY ALWAYS GIVE YOU A WEEKS WARNING BEFORE HAND.


There is only ONE, ONE excuse that is acceptable for AFKing, and that is an actual emergency like someone having just injured them self bad enough to need to go to the hospital, or someone has just died. Real emergencies. Not fake bull%%%%.


And if you need to go out to dinner/lunch/party/whatever in 40 minutes, don't start a %%%%ing match in LoL, because you %%%%ING KNOW YOU WONT BE THERE TO FINISH IT SO %%%%ING DON'T EVEN LOG IN.

"ppl who have less than perfect internet/computers shouldn't play this game" great moneymaking scheme well done
just lost 80% of your market

Yeah because 80% of dedicated PC gamers have no idea how to use a computer and actually keep up on maintenance.


EDIT: And don't even bother talking about casuals. League of Legends is not a casual game, and doesn't cater to casuals.

Whatever state people keep their computers in doesn't matter, either way you still lose 80% income, that isn't enough to keep the game running to the level it is, 

Secondly, millions of people play this game very few of which are involved in proper competitions, of course it's a casual game,
If you want to remove casual players then you are down to single digits % of players
remember this game is a business and as such customers are important.

Where the %%%% do you get your fake statistics?


You need to shut up and never say anything on these forums again with your bleeding heart bull%%%% reasoning unless if you can provide solid evidence to back up your %%%%.

Someone's mad?
I laugh every time we have this discussion because it's totally pointless, neither one of us will agree with the other, I'm just a lowly casual player and you judging from your ridicule of others and language regarding 'casuals' that you must be challenger or at least master tier, so it's only natural that our opinions differ,

 the only way we will ever conclude whose opinion is better for the community is if the leaver buster changes, if it changes to make leaver buster harsher then it means that riot also thinks the way you do and I'll have to acknowledge you as being correct,
And if they change it to make it less harsh then riot thinks more like I do and it shows that my opinion is more suited for the community, 
that's the only way this argument will ever be resolved.

Why does Leaver Buster need to change at all? Asking people to do basic computer maintenance is not the realm of the so called "hardcore elite". Anyone with a computer should have anti-virus and anti-malware software installed, and an automated scan every week is simple. Defragging every few months is useful, but not necessary, and everything I've just said can be set up to run automatically. 

The rest is just common sense: if you're going out in an hour, get ready and do something else instead of a league match. If there's a bad storm, do something else. And just because there are casual players doesn't make this a casual game. This is neither a casual nor an elite game. It's just a game. Neither of you have any access to Riot's statistics, so you have no idea how many people are casual, hardcore or anywhere in between. Why are people so eager to label games?

As for your statistics, keep them to yourself. Unless you have an actual source, statistics are useless. How do you know anything about the power of the average users PC? With the advances in computers over the last few years, and the rapid hardware development time, I could build a gaming PC for $500 that could easily run League of Legends, and if you keep your system healthy, you won't have any boot or crash issues. Klavinmour's swearing isn't necessary, but your fake, unfounded statistics only hurt your argument too.

Also, only a small fraction of the player base posts on the forum, so any kind of commentary on the community without access to Riot's info is pointless and misleading.

>everything I've just said can be set up to run automatically. 

While you're in the middle of a game you find that your FPS grinds down to a halt because your virus scanner has automatically opened up and is gleefully sorting through and rearranging your files.

Unfounded statistics are made up, and those who know would not believe in them, but approximations are fine; they're up to a person's opinion, not matter of fact.
You make very good points in all your posts!

Thank you.

You yourself are a well mannered and reasonable Lord, and your points are striking. I respect that.
Thank you :)
Ass kissing alert.

All your points are very valid and I agree with all of them
It really only comes down to wants in the end, I want leaver buster to be less harsh so I don't freak out if my internet fails, and Klavinmour wants it to be more harsh so it punishes the people who make him lose games by afking

I do computer maintenance just like everyone else, but my system isn't perfect the Internet or powercut safe box does fail occasionally, but I don't want to stop playing lol completely because 1 in 50 games will fail 
Also lots of riots statistics are made public 
The statistics I used before are purely my own predictions, however they aren't stabbing in the dark, milllions of people play this game and if you account for the few hundred people in challenger division in each region and the LCS teams and the region teams too, even counting the few individuals who make enough from YouTube that IS indeed in the single digits in % of people who are full time LoL players, it's just maths anything other than full time players has to be casual. 
They aren't just random there is logic behind them, however they aren't official you are right.

Not all of us can afford $500 to build a gaming pc
Many of us have to make do with the laptop we use for uni or school, which is a Mac if you are in the creative industry which isn't ideal, but like you say it's just a game we shouldnt be required to have hundreds of dollars invested in a pc that is only used for a game we play only 2 or 3 hours a day. 

All my entire argument is saying is: lol should be a game that all can enjoy, even those who have dodgy connections and such, those people shouldnt be banned just because they live somewhere without fibre or live in a stormy area, hell it's an American game and they are known for their tornadoes. If you have a dodgy connection you shouldn't play ranked, that's fair because that is affecting others, but you shoudknt be forbidden from playing normals, which is kinda what leaverbuster does atm, one of my friends has quit completely because he lives on a farm with bad ping and DC's for 10 min every 5 games or so, he never played ranked but he spent around $100 on skins because he liked the game, but leaverbuster has given him ridiculous q times and he has just given up, I guess that's why I feel strongly about it,

Anyway all the points you have made are pretty strong and i appreciate your equality and objectifying the situation not being attached to it and swearing ect 

I agree with what you say and will not use my own predictions as statistics again :)

>All my entire argument is saying is: lol should be a game that all can enjoy

If everyone thought like this, it would be a much better game.
Hell, that would make for a better *world*.
Yea it sure would, if we could all be tolerant it would be great

Wow. I feel really bad with my $2500 custom pc now. I spent 8 weeks after High School working with Dad, and then dropped 2k on it just before Uni. My PC is my baby though, it's pretty much all I have, besides my 40k models. 

Back on topic, I don't necessarily think that you can consider everyone who doesn't make a living from League of Legends a casual. I'm sure there are many players in all divisions who play seriously, regardless of skill level or potential. That's why I disagree with all generalisations that try to classify people: without knowing every single player, you can't quantify them all.

You are pretty right there I guess with the classifying of people.

And I'm jealous of your computer :P
Although I do love my Mac haha

http://www.lolking.net/summoner/oce/223985#profile
bronze 3 XD
well thats a mistake i made then :P
That sort of hatred and bigotry is unacceptable in society.

>League of Legends is not a casual game

It's a video-game. You play it to have fun and waste time. Yeah, people have made careers out of it, but even they still play it sometimes for fun and nothing else.

>TAKING CARE OF THEIR COMPUTER LIKE THEY SHOULD.

What if it's just old/low-end? I once used a notebook provided by a business that legit took 8 minutes to boot up, and it was Windows 7 too.

>Three hours a week

That's insane for something like a computer. You don't even maintain your car for that much time.

>100% your own fault and you deserve it

I wouldn't say 100%. If a part breaks as you are playing and it crashes, it's just out of your control and there probably was nothing you could do to prevent it/predict it. You should not play if your computer is constantly crashing, though.

>Hell you don't even deserve a computer if you treat it like that.

You can't *not* deserve a computer if you aren't maintaining it. That doesn't make sense. The only thing I can think of to make you not deserve a computer is if you are creating malicious viruses for other computers with it, the sole intent being to ruin the experience for everyone else.

>You can easily find out before you start playing if your internet will be having trouble, and if you don't do that then again you deserve to be banned.

This I agree with. It doesn't take too much to bring up a command prompt and ping the OCE servers. Banning people that fail to do so, though? Please remember that this is a video-game, designed for people to have fun.

>The same with power outages, DON'T PLAY IN THE MIDDLE OF A %%%%ING STORM.

Not all storms cause power outages, and if there's a storm then you're most likely inside the house. Playing video-games is a way to pass the time.

>There is only ONE, ONE excuse that is acceptable for AFKing, and that is an actual emergency like someone having just injured them self bad enough to need to go to the hospital, or someone has just died. Real emergencies. Not fake bull%%%%.

I'd go and answer my door if someone knocks on it. It's rude not to. You really want people to have died if someone goes afk?

>And if you need to go out to dinner/lunch/party/whatever in 40 minutes, don't start a %%%%ing match in LoL, because you %%%%ING KNOW YOU WONT BE THERE TO FINISH IT SO %%%%ING DON'T EVEN LOG IN.

It's just the twelvies that do this.

You have a lot of rage and a lot of intolerance.

Wow.
Good points

It takes more than one DC to get low priority queue. It also only takes 5 or so minutes for Leavebuster to activate. So, based on that, you would have had to disconnect from a significant number of games for *at least* 5 minutes in each instance in order to get placed in low priority queue.
No it doesn't, the new Leaver Buster gives you no chances, ONE DC of five minutes or more is all you need for your first low priority queue.

No it doesn't, i have DC'd several (read 3) times during new leaverbuster, without many DC's before new leaverbuster, and i am still yet to get Low Priority queue.

Who cares? Grow up and deal with it.

I've never intentionally afkd & rito should understand s**t happens
